intro: Thymelaea tarton-raira subsp. austroiberica, commonly known as the Canary Island thymelaea, is a shrub native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showing a preference for well-drained soils. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in Mediterranean-type climates. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of its genus with limited geographic distribution.
